title: Child Learning Interaction Analysis Strategies Using Mobile Eye-Tracking

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: For science museum/educational program managers and content development leaders. Case study on applying mobile eye-tracking technology to analyze real-world child learning environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain mobile eye-tracking methodologies for analyzing visual attention distribution in child learning environments
Learners can interpret gaze data collected from actual museum/educational settings to derive learning interaction patterns
Learners can propose educational resource optimization strategies based on analytical results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
